WRITING.TEXT:
TO: Gabbabba the Hutt
SUBJ: Meeting
MESSAGE: I have no problems with no weapons. Will I be travelling to Klatooine, or will this be on Coruscant? -G.V.

TO: MARKASHARKA CUB'BA
SUBJ: Meeting
MESSAGE: I am indeed. Can you set up a meeting? -G.V.

"We do have the equipment, yes. If we can make this deal, I can send a message to Akiva and they can get the site started. Besides an energy source and a waste disposal method, is there anything else you would need for a foundry?"
I'd guess that they have some sort of high-tech thrust vectoring system.
It sounds more like Lupita N'yongo (Maz Kanata)

"As I said, as far as Akiva is concerned, we just need to read the fine print, but other than that, we're golden."
([m] /u/psychogobstopper)
"I can say that my government will probably shoot that through in a heartbeat. After they make sure the fine print doesn't mean that afterwards we have to become slaves or whatever." Gannit chuckled.
"Well, there you go. Plenty of need for biofoam," Gannit said, throwing his hands in the air enthusiastically, partly because his seeming pipe dream is another step closer to reality.
:P
You gave me a kissy face
Hey. Buddy. I don't swing that way, but power to you.
Same here. Smack dab in the middle, furthest back row. :D

Maybe about twenty minutes. :P
Reserved seating FTW! :D

"Does Csilla have any mining operations? Shipbuilding? Any sort of high-hazard fields?"
[m]/u/psychogobstopper; Sorry for the delay. Homework and class.

Gannit welcomed his friend.
"It's quite alright. Please, have a seat."
"That could, yes. Have you ever considered use of geothermal energy? "

WRITING.TITLE: In trying to buy tickets, Star Wars fans executed a massive DDOS unintentionally

WRITING.TEXT:
Got mine!
12:45 PM on the 19th. Furthest back row, right smack dab in the center.
The theater was actually pretty empty, except for a few seats here and there, and two large groups (a 7 and an 8) that were down in the middle.
Fortunately, the theater (building) serves a somewhat small population, so my odds were good.
Tried to get the 10:45, but the pick-a-seat thing wasn't loading. Oh well. Less morning rush!
[M: That works]

"He's quite friendly. You'll probably like him."
[Meta: Nah. He's not that sort. Did you get the bacta issue solved, because I have an idea to use if it didn't]
"There are indeed plenty of places, but we do have some rather strict environmental laws. How environmentally friendly are your factories?"
"My world of Akiva is an untapped potential resource. In the interest of full disclosure, I do have a deal in the works with BlasTech, but i don't believe they're a competitor, are they?"

Well, BB-8 is an original design, for example (IIRC).
I think it's more of as a tribute to him than anything else.
But they have designers for everything not pulled from RMQ. And even for the stuff they did pull from him, they still need designers to actually design how to build it
I love the last bowl.

Seeing her arrive, he paused the program he was listening too, and tucked the receivers in his pocket and set his datapad down. "That's fantastic news!" said Gannit standing to greet her with an enthusiastic handshake. "Now, we wait."
[m] Gannit doesn't have any aides. He's a one-man operation. For now, at least.
Same reason why we can have private jets, as well as 747s: technology improved so they got smaller but retained the same/have more power.

Well, the Vader design can be argued, too, that it's stylized, as Rebels is.
But yeah, I love it.
Gannit returns it with a nod and smile.

They have been using a lot of his pieces in the movie. Like the split-engine of the T-70s and that one archway on Jakku is identical to a concept piece for Tatooine he drew.
I love it.
RIP Ralph.

"Thank you." He paused to sit. "That's quite alright. None are necessary," he said with a dismissive hand wave. "I've come to talk shop. Might Baktoid be interested in opening a new branch on an untapped world, deep in the Outer Rim?"

WRITING.TITLE: ELI5: What prevents people from crossing a border to circumvent public domain laws?
WRITING.TEXT:
For example, Aldous Huxley's *Brave New World* is pubic domain in Canada, but still under copyright until the '30s in the US.
If I was a filmmaker and I filmed an adaptation of *BNW* in Canada, wouldn't I be exempt from any fees, etc., because the work is in public domain in Canada, but not the US?
Or, more realistically, what is preventing me from flying to Toronto, getting a printed copy for a couple bucks (since it's now PD there and it's just to recoup publishing costs) and flying back?
"Perhaps! Oftentimes, people are turned off by non-traditionally colored beverages, clears, browns, whites and such, but blue, to me, is my favorite color." Gannit smiles and sips.
"Thanks for inviting me," he said, getting himself some blue milk, guzzling it, then refilling it. "Have you ever had this stuff?"

WRITING.TITLE: [Lobby] The Senator for Akiva requests the presence of the senators from Csilla and Serenno.
WRITING.TEXT:
The office was far more decorated now. The painting from the senator from Serenno sits on the wall to the right of the entrance, just inside the often-open doorway.
Doing away with convention, he was as a one-man operation, as well as having eight exceedingly comfortable and identical chairs arranged in an octagonal formation where the desk normally would be. In the center is a small-to-medium sized table for datapads, refreshments and what-have-yous. Around the room are various historical and modern sculputes, paintings and knick-knacks he bought on Coruscant, and a few he had shipped in from his homeworld of Akiva, as well as a couple Naboo pieces, and an impressionist painting of a bantha from an artist on Tatooine.
Gannit Valeris sat in the chair facing the door, waiting for his guests, passing time listening to local audio entertainment programming on his in-ear receivers, while checking the latest news from around the galaxy and replying to messages from his fellow Akivans.
[m] /u/grmuldoon, /u/psychogobstopper
"I'm glad to." Gannit smiled and shook her hand.
"I will set up a meeting for the three of us. In the mean time, can you take the proposal to your government, make sure they are willing to sign off on it?"
"Good day to you, Senator."
Seeing the door open and people inside, Gannit foregoes his usual knock-and-wait ritual of politeness and, instead, walks in. In his had he holds a tall temperature-controlled mug of blue milk.

"I'll tell him you said that," Gannit says with a wink.
"And, if it might perhaps sweeten the deal for your planet, pending approval from his government, the Chiss senator has said that they might be willing to suspend domestic bacta sales, in favor of yours for up to two years, if Serenno is willing to help fund the hyperlane project. Now, they would still sell on other worlds, since 'exotic' items are always in vogue, but you would have a domestic monopoly on Csilla for up to two years. Interested?"
[m] IRL, this deal just happened last night, otherwise I'd have mentioned it earlier.
"It is. A pleasure to meet you, Senator Teker. I wanted to come by and introduce myself, as well as to talk shop, if I may?"
Gannit Valeris calmly knocks on the door.
"And with you, sir."

"I'd be glad to. Just know that he likes to eat baby Chiss while you talk with him."
Gannit pauses and waits for a reaction.
"Many thanks. I'll get send this off immediately and let you know if my government has any questions or concerns." Gannit extends his hand.

"Fantastic. If I could get a copy too, for my government to look over. Check the fine print and everything? Make sure that we're not going to have to sell you the planet or else you'll use a giant space laser to blow us up?" Gannit laughed.
A giant space laser? Please. Like that'll ever happen, he thought to himself.

"Up, I assume? Depending on the blaster, some of them probably out power yours, especially some of the hunting rifles. We call it a Heavyhide. Big thing, about three meters at the shoulder, nose horn, hide thick enough to use as starship hull. Well, not really, but you get my point. Standard power blasters just make it mad, so we had to crank up the power to punch through its hide. Lots of good meat on it though."
"What sort of modifications?"

"As I said, pretty much everyone has a gun. Though, I know you'd prefer the guns to be BlasTech, I think if you hired locals as part of the BlasTech security force and let them use their own guns, I think it would be beneficial to us and you, since we have our own defending you, but you also keeping them employed. And letting them use their own weapons would be a big plus for them, since I know a lot of people have named them and treat them as they might a pet. Well, not a lot, but a good number. We are still very rural and used to handling things on our own, especially outside of the cities where there is no police force."
[meta] Sorry if I'm a bit rambly. I'm too tired to be awake, but too awake to be tired. And when I get tired, I can get rambly.

"Good to hear. I know a lot of times that companies come in and outright force the locals out of business. As for the Isolationists, they are all talk, albeit really good talk. Got 8% in my election, so they are definitely not a 'fringe group' anymore. Mostly, you can probably expect protests and a lot of rhetoric. I assume you would also need a security team for the site?"

Gannit visibly winces when he says 'arms dealers'. "I know they technically are arms dealers, since a lot of them have their own shops to their wares, but there's the inherent negative connotation. How about 'weapon artisans'? Since it's all above board and licensed businesses."
He paused a moment, hoping he hadn't just pissed off a potential moneymaker for the planet. "So, what would BlasTech do with those who didn't want to become part of the operation on the planet? And what about those of the Isolationist Movement?"

"She's way out in the Outer Rim, towards Wild Space. Not near any major hyperlanes, so pretty safe."
Gannit paused.
"But pretty much everyone there has a gun, since we are so far from everything. It took me three weeks to get here. That far. Because it's a very arms-friendly planet, being so rural, might BlasTech be interested in opening up shop on the planet? It is a ways out, but you would have a monopoly, at least for a while. I could, perhaps, even negotiate for a one year guaranteed monopoly, as long as you don't gouge us." Gannit said with a smile and a wink. "We do have plenty of local arms makers, so you know. And because, for them, it's their livelihood, I wouldn't want you to shut them down, but, perhaps, you could collaborate with them? Buy designs off of them, or even bring them on full-time as designers? Something like that."
"Have you ever heard of Akiva?"
"I wanted to come by, introduce myself and see if BlasTech was potentially interested in opening a new branch in the Outer Rim."
"That could work too. Well, we need something to put on the proposal, though."
Gannit returns the bow. "A pleasure to meet you, sir." Gannit extends a hand.
"Fantastic. When I meet with her, I'll let her know. So, can I count on your support for this...I don't know. What do we want to call it? The Great Outer Rim Hyperlane?"

"Excellent. So, would two year exclusivity be feasible, or would one year be easier to do?"
Gannit paused. "And I don't think you would need to put it on hold, but perhaps make it for export, while Serenno's is used locally. Trust me when I say that things from new, foreign worlds, in this case Chiss bacta, always have a massive draw, even if it's just a rock with a face carved in it. You might even be able to sell it for more than you normally would because it's 'exotic'."
"So nothing too dissimilar from certain Republic member worlds, then? I don't think most will have a problem with that."
"Like a fighter escort until touchdown, or escorted around the planet?"

WRITING.TITLE: [LOBBY] A message to all senators and representatives.
WRITING.TEXT:
I am seeking to open a dialogue with the Hutts. If any of you have a means of contact, or know someone with contacts, please relay that information to me as soon as possible.
Thank you.
-G.V.

"Fantastic. I'm working on getting support from other worlds, both on the Outer Rim, as well as inner worlds. Would the Ascendancy be in need of bacta, potentially? I'm acquainted with the senator from Serenno, and they have bacta to offer, and, being a wealthy world, if we can assure them of a certain duration, say a year or two, of being the exclusive provider of bacta to our worlds, it may make gaining financial capital from them easier."
Gannit knocks on the door and waits patiently.
"I was asking because, if my hyperlane idea goes through, could and would the Ascendancy be willing to contribute funds to the project?"

"Thank you for having me...Frea," said Gannit, echoing back to his initial discomfort at being on a first-name basis.
"And thanks again for letting me wash up. I hope I didn't make your refresher too disgusting."

"Oh, of course."
Gannit paused, creating a moment of awkward silence.
"I wanted to apologize if I intruded on anything when we met my first day here. I know it said "near-human", but I wanted to meet my fellow senators, and your office was open. That's been sitting on me for a while and I just wanted to clear the air."

"Ideally, with enough funding and support, it would run from Dac, all the way around," said Gannit, illustrating with a finger, back to Dac. Or Csilla to Csilla. You get the idea."
He paused to take a breath, then resumed, "Realistically, probably from Dac to Csilla, but with worlds in-between, including Akiva. Both of their respective senators are all but committed to the idea, if that makes it any more appealing. Though, in the interest of full disclosure, the senator from Csilla would like a proposal, in-hand, to present to his government to help convince them. I have a few other senators open to the idea, but nothing concrete as of yet."
"Once I have a few worlds signed on, would you like to see the proposal? I have a map of the idealized route already drawn up, and I'd include it in the proposal."
"What if I could offer Serenno a monopoly, for a year or two, on bacta sales on Akiva. In exchange, they'd help fund the longest hyperlane ever made?"
"I meant coreward relative to my Csilla and Dac. But I am aware of the difficulties. The cost to the Republic would partly be offset by funding from planets on the route."

"It would connect far more worlds than those two. But, as I said, I don't want to go into too much detail before I have something concrete. If you'd like, I could keep you apprised, regardless of the outcome of the vote. Having a coreward ally could be helpful."

Awesome.
Having a vet in will be a big bonus.

"Without going into too many specifics since I don't have any firm committals, it would be the biggest hyperlane ever made, connecting Dac to Csilla, in short. And, if we can get others on board, back around to Dac again."

"A large part was that both Senator Aberal and I are from the Outer Rim. He and I also discussed a project I had in mind for the Outer Rim and he was enthusiastic and seemed on board with the project."

"Some cold blue milk if you have it? If not, cold water will be fine." Gannit said to the attendant, as he sat.
"If I may be frank, I voted for Senator Aberal."
Gannit knocks on the door and patiently waits for a reply.

WRITING.TITLE: Awesome On Its Own 2.0
WRITING.TEXT:
Back in the day, some RT members did lipsyncs to songs and called it [Awesome On Its Own](https://www.youtube.com/user/AwesomeOnItsOwn/videos)
RT's Fluffnight and I are (slowly) working to reboot it. Would any of you be interested in being a part of it and being internet sorta-kinda-not-really famous?

Building on what /u/listyraesder said
Trek rights aren't that complicated. In 2000, Viacom bought CBS, and merged Paramount Television (producers of Star Trek) into CBS. In 2005, Viacom split up into CBS Corporation (CBS, what was Paramount TV including UPN, etc) and a new Viacom (Paramount Pictures, MTV Networks). This is why UPN and The WB merged into The CW, as UPN was now part of CBS. Now, Viacom and CBS Corp are both owned by National Amusements, and the rights to Trek were split up so that the feature film rights went to Paramount and the TV rights went to CBS. But as they're sibling companies, priority goes to the one which is raking in the money. At the moment, Paramount is making massive bank on Trek films, and is opposed to any new Trek TV because they're operating on a specific cycle of supply-and-demand and a series might impact their film's performance. CBS is co-owner of The CW, which is run by Mark Pedowitz. He is extremely keen on having a new Trek series, to the point where he brings it up with CBS Studios quite regularly. However, as Paramount won't give their blessing, there's no current plans to go for it. He especially wanted one for the 50th anniversary but hey.
Paramount also has to pay CBS licensing for any TV characters used (e.g. Kirk, Spock, et al.), and vice versa. So, for *First Contact*, Paramount had to pay CBS to use the TNG characters, but then CBS had to pay Paramount to use the Borg Queen in *Voyager*, for example.
So, it is somewhat complicated, but not a massive clusterfuck. Somewhere about a Marvel level of fuckitude.
Reindeers are better than people
This kid is going places.

"Some other senators and I have been toying with the idea of a mega-hyperlane, I guess you could call it, that runs from Dac to Csilla. I did a cursory mapping, and the Ison Corridor could easily be integrated as part of it. And, since Bespin is the only major world along there, I was thinking your planet could be a major stop along the way. Actually, the third-to-last, in the interest of full disclosure. It'd go to one more world, the Csilla."

Gannit sits in the chair next to the senator, trying to indicate this is a personal plea.
"How would Bespin like to be a part of, and a part financier of, a massive new hyperlane that runs through the Outer Rim and into the Unknown Regions?"
"Fantastic. What is Csilla's economy like right now?"
"I'm quite well. Please, have a seat." Gannit said, waiting for the Senator to sit.

"I'm working on that. If you can wait a few weeks, I can have something to present."
[m] A few days, that is. Allow time to respond and all that.

Gannit was silent for a moment, imagining the views. "Sounds absolutely gorgeous."
Gannit snapped back to reality. "How would Serenno like a new market for goods?"

"Of course," he said, quietly wondering for a half second if there wasn't some tiff between them, since a birthday call wouldn't be more than a few minutes.
"CorSec is the planetary security agency, I take it?"
"Sorry. Just...wow. I'm sorry about all that with your planet. I have a few ideas about things. You?"

"In my half, heading towards the cold season. The other half is warming up. I'm here in a semi-official capacity, for once. I was wondering if you've talked to your government at all about the hyperlane idea I had?"

Gannit walks out of a side corridor a few minutes later and sees the senator at the door.
"Senator Figg. Sorry for the wait. I had to have a meeting with Madam Nature."
Gannit sits in stunned silence, processing everything.
"What sort of issues?"

"Good advice. So many faces and names all at once. I'm used to one or two people for a couple hours, tops, and then another set. Ugh. My brain needs to rewire itself."
Gannit takes a long drink of his blue milk.
"Oh, definitely. I've already got a couple things in mind. You?"

"I did. Outer Rim favors Halcyon and Inner Rim favors...oh my gosh. I'm completely blanking on her name. Oh. This is embarrassing."
[meta] I actually did forget.

"Delicious," said Gannit, taking a big gulp.
"Man, this is delicious. Ever had it?"
"Cold blue milk, if you have it? I'm addicted to the stuff."
"Just dropping by. How goes Csilla?"
"Indeed. Personally, I ultimately favored Rhulba and Aberal. But, that's democracy. Yourself?"
Gannit knocks on the door.
[meta] Thanks!
"Oh, no. Perhaps geographically confused, but not patronizing," said Gannit with a big smile.

WRITING.TITLE: [LOBBY] The senator for Akiva would like to have a private meeting with the senator from Bespin
WRITING.TEXT:
The room, cleaned up from the party, looks as spartan as it has since day one, but now the gift painting from the senator from Serenno sits on the wall to the left of Gannit's desk. The simple chairs still sit in front of Gannit's desk.
[m] /u/2Bornottobee
"Good day, Ranik. Just dropping by to say hello. Maybe steal some design ideas."

"Indeed it shall. So, I was wondering. I'm not all that familiar with Serenno. What is the planet like? What sort of imports and exports do you have?"
[M] It's all good. I think I have once or twice too.

"If she had her heart in the right place and the right goals, sure. I mean, if she is some evildoer who wants to take over the galaxy through manipulation, than no, she wouldn't. But if her goals are peace-through-friendship, then sure. You know?"
Gannit knocks on the door and waits for a reply.
Aye.
Aye.
"Interesting. So, what are your thoughts on Troy and Abera?"

"Or perhaps I'll beat you again!"
Gannit leans in over the table.
"Don't tell anyone this, but my voting pendulum is definitely swinging towards you."

Gannit moves the Kintan strider and begins the game.
[m] Dinner for me.

"Certainly. As long as I get to win. You do want to secure my vote, don't you?" Gannit said with a smile, and walked over to the table. "I kid, of course. You probably will win. I'm not particularly good at dejarik."
"Without giving too much away, he and I may or may not have discussed linking Csilla and Akiva as part of a new hyperlane. Not gonna say anything definitive, though," Gannit said with a wink.
"I've never been one to overstay my welcome as it is. Thank you for having me and best of luck in all your elections."

"Except the Corellian Run is a major thoroughfare. Akiva is far enough away, for the time being, that it would take pirates and other uncouth sorts at least several days to get there from the end of the Run, plus raiding a more rural planet is time consuming...and pretty much everyone has a gun. And then it'd be several days back. Basically, the time and risk of return fire from an entire town would outweigh any potential benefit."
"And perhaps the Chiss?"

"I plan to draw them in because Akiva has little outside presence, so they would have a monopoly on the planet. I could, possibly, even work with the governor and lock in that monopoly for a short period, maybe a year or two, as long as they agreed not to sell at a price about the same on other planets. No one likes being gouged."
"No. I picked up the recipe from a trader from Tatooine. No idea where he got it from."
"It is. Why do you ask?"

"What about if we could get planets that will be part of it, as well as the Commerce Guild, the IBC, and the like to help offset some of the costs? Would that make it more appealing to do before debt reduction?"
Gannit paused.
"And, as part of it, we could redistribute some funds to offset the cost. Even allocating 10, 15 percent of the defense budget to it would be a help. Plus, having a new major hyperlane out there would help defense of the outer edges of the Republic, which is the argument that could be made I support of reallocation."
"Well, my neighborhood is having a festivity for my election, and my shops are having a special 10% off sale between now and the election. Other than that, nothing in particular. How about Corellia?"
"Oh. Those are halla peppers wrapped in crisped porcine meat."

I don't think the xenophobia is around, either.
It was probably created to explain why all of the Imperials were human males.
Remember, we've only hit 1979-1980, as far as EU-equivalency, so there's still 35 years of a universe to build.

"Oh, indeed?"
Gannit suddenly changed to a more serious tone.
"If I may break from my camaraderie here and get political for a moment, I was wondering, as Chancellor, what would your thoughts be on establishing a new circumgalactic hyperlane?"
"Dejarik? Interesting. Didn't think of that. Perhaps I could have game table with some pazaak and sabaac decks? And a big holoscreen? Hey. I could be the party office!" Gannit laughs.

FROM: Gannit Valeris, Senator for Akiva
SUBJ: Salutations
MESSAGE: Good day, Senator. I'm Gannit Valeris, the Senator for Akiva. I was hoping to meet you in person soon, before the election. My schedule is rather open, and my office door is always open. If you would feel more comfortable meeting in your office, it's but a short walk. Many thanks, and have a great day.
-G.V.

"The election? Still undecided. Honestly, I'm putting more focus on the VC. That's where the real power is, all things considered. As for that, I've got an idea, but I'm not saying anything until I'm sure."
"Good day. I just wanted to introduce myself and to meet one of the candidates for Chancellor. Gannit Valeris, Akiva. Pleasure to meet you."
"On the other hand, Administrator, what if you could say that you were part of the team that assembled a hyperspace lane that makes the Corellian Run look like the Ison Corridor?"
"I've only met Rhulba so far. Haven't met Halcyon. Still weighing my options. You?"

"What surrounding planets?" Gannit says with a cheerful laugh. "Y'know, I guess one good thing about being out in the middle of nowhere is that there are no pirates around. Nearest inhabited planet is Alzoc III, and we don't do business with them much. Maybe have a couple Talz a year on the planet, tops. Business comes from the direction of the Corellian Run, usually, and even that is a few days at lightspeed through unlaned space."
"The senator from Serenno gifted me a painting at my meet-and-greet earlier. First decoration so far. Not sure what to do for the rest. Any ideas?"
"What about economically? Taxes and tariffs and what have you? What about Chiss relations?"
"True. True. What are your stances?"
"Oh, you're quite clever, aren't you?" Gannit said with a big laugh
"So far, yes. Everyone's friendly so far. Just came by to say hello and maybe steal some decoration ideas."

"I see. Well, as for supporting you, I can't speak for them. As for the list, until we're ready to pull the trigger on it, I'd like to keep it quiet. Get enough planets and a start on a budget before the pitch. I hope you understand? It's not a trust thing, it's just a matter of practicality."
"It's gorgeous. If you'd like, on your next vacation, I could coordinate and see if you can be there for a day or two?"
"You're running? Which seat?"
With a non-committal shrug, Gannit replies, "I try."
"Well, thank you. How have you been enjoying your office?"
"Great views, small populace. Lots of potential. Not much else. That's why I'm here."
"Well, here's to learning stuff at 42." Gannit raises his glass and sips

"Well, that's more than I knew. You know, one of these days, I should read up on the profiles of the systems."
[Meta] Or do a Wookieepedia refresher course. :P

"What I was getting at is, if pirates knew that they may, potentially, be hitting a Hutt ship, wouldn't that, if they're smart, give them pause, even for a minute? And if the Hutts see that other ships are being hit, it may make them worry about their own."

"Ask me again in a month once our sales figures come in," Gannit said with a laugh.
[meta] No problem. Yay Rebels is back! Woooooo!
"Nor I them. Thank you for the suggestion. I'll definitely look into that." Gannit said with a genuine smile, sipping some blue milk. "Know anything about the Hapans?"
"True. But what if the Hutts had a financial stake in the success of the lane? Even the Hutts run legitimate cargo from time to time."

Gannit replied with a smile, "Excellent."
He paused. "What if the planetary governments that would be stops along the way, as well as the Republic, agreed to contribute to the cost of forging the lane? Would that help make it more appealing?"
"Have you met the Hapan senator?"
Gannit knocks on the door and patiently waits.
Gannit knocked on the door and quietly waited.

"Excellent. Administrator, if I may ask a question, how would Muunilinst feel about being a stop, pardon the term, on a grand new hyperlane idea that I had, and that a couple of other senators are potentially on board with?"

"Exactly. Actually, I couldn't sleep last night, so I drew up a theoretical route for the Galactic Rim Hyperlane." He drew with hi finger, "It would go from Dac, hitting planets that are already on lanes, turning them into hub worlds, which is a big economic boon, all the way to Csilla, then all the way back around to Dac."
After a beat, Gannit added, "Ideally, of course."

"Wow. Thank you. You have the unique honor of giving my my first decoration." Gannit gave her large smile. "Please, come in. Partake. Enjoy. Mingle."
Gannit gave her a nod and placed the package atop his desk at the far end of the room.
"Fantastic. I can say that the Dac senator would be on board. The Senator from Reaper's World may be, as well. And, if I overheard correctly, the Muunilinst government might be too?"
"Oh, yes. But, when I met him on his arrival, he seemed open to the idea. And, perhaps, the Sullustian-slash-Commerce Guild representative as well."
"How's the food?"
"How goes the evening, sir?"

Gannit smiles.
"Theoretically, what would the Ascendancy, Csilla, specifically, think of being an endpoint of what could be the largest contiguous hyperlane the galaxy has seen, and maybe will ever see?"

"Perhaps the Chiss senator, though it would require much convincing of his government. Think of it. A route from Dac, around the rim, to Akiva, all the way to Csilla. And, maybe, if we're ambitious enough, all the way around again to Dac?"

"Oh, yes? My apologies. I hope I didn't offend. I just meant like Tatooine, for example. Or Geonosis. And Coruscant. Coruscant, as big as it is, would have trouble growing crops what with all these buildings."

"Indeed. We're well off any major lanes, but not Wild Space far. What about a lane straight from Dac to Akiva, to Bespin, say? The "Galactic Rim Hyperlane"? Bespin, big tibanna producer. Dac, shipyards. You see what I'm saying?"

"I understand. There is a small, but growing movement on my world called the Akivan Isolationist Movement. Basically, it's a reaction to our, well, isolation. They're a 'if the Republic doesn't want us, then we don't want it' group. Got 8% in the election. Short-term, yes. We can survive on our own. Maybe a few centuries, max, but, eventually, we're gonna need help from the Republic. Burned bridges and all that."
"That and it is about a billion lightyears from anywhere and near no hyperspace lanes."
Well, besides my ship repair business, we have plenty of bazaars, as well as natural beauty on our world. We have the market, just no goods."
"Reap away," said Gannit, fully aware of what he said.

"Or at least equal to the Mid Rim, yes. We'll never be Coruscants, or even Naboos, realistically, but we can probably become equal to at least Mid Rim. We'd trade with each other, and build tourism, as well as working to get a greater share of the galactic spotlight."
